LanguageData.RepairFracture.label: Repair fracture: osteosynthetic surgery
LanguageData.RepairFracture.description: Surgically repair a bone fracture. The bone will be set in place, realigned, and reinforced with metal plates and screws to prevent micromovements and promote proper healing, allowing the patient to regain full use of the affected limb much faster than with other methods.\n\nAlthough being more invasive than other methods, surgery allows for a more precise and stable repair of the fracture, ensuring a faster and more complete recovery.
LanguageData.SplintFracture.label: Splint a fracture
LanguageData.SplintFracture.description: Apply a splint to immobilize a bone fracture and promote healing over time. The splint will stabilize the bone, prevent further damage, and allow the patient to move around without risking further injury. The stabilized bone will heal naturally over time.\n\nA simple and non-invasive procedure that can be performed by anyone with basic medical knowledge.
LanguageData.SplintFracture.successfullyRemovedHediff: {0} has splinted {1}'s bone fracture. It will take some time to heal.
LanguageData.RestoreHearing.label: Restore hearing: cellular regenerative surgery
LanguageData.RestoreHearing.description: Cellular regenerative otologic surgery (CROS) is an experimental glitterworld surgery that uses mechanites to repair damaged hair cells in the inner ear, restoring hearing to a person with permanent hearing loss. The procedure is expensive and not widely available, but has shown promising results in restoring hearing, even in very severe cases.
LanguageData.RemoveHemorrhagicStroke_Ultratech.label: Cure stroke: stereotactic surgery
LanguageData.RemoveHemorrhagicStroke_Ultratech.descri:
Perform stereotactic surgery to cure a hemorrhagic stroke.
Stereotactic surgery is a minimally invasive form of surgical intervention that makes use of a three-dimensional coordinate system to locate small targets inside the body, allowing for precise localization of the ruptured blood vessel while minimizing damage to surrounding tissues.

A very complex and delicate procedure that requires a high level of skill and precision but yields a very high success rate.
LanguageData.RemoveHemorrhagicStroke_Industrial.label: Cure stroke: decompressive craniectomy
LanguageData.RemoveHemorrhagicStroke_Industrial.descr:
Perform a decompressive craniectomy to cure a hemorrhagic stroke.
Decompressive craniectomy is a neurosurgical procedure in which part of the skull is removed to allow a swelling or herniating brain room to expand without being squeezed. It is performed on victims of traumatic brain injury, stroke, Chiari malformation, and other conditions associated with raised intracranial pressure. Use of this surgery is controversial and associated with a higher risk of complications, but it can be life-saving in cases of severe brain swelling.

A challenging surgery that requires familiarity with neurosurgical techniques and a steady hand. Yields a moderate success rate.
LanguageData.RemoveHemorrhagicStroke_Tribal.label: Cure stroke: trepanation
LanguageData.RemoveHemorrhagicStroke_Tribal.descripti:
Perform a trepanation to cure a hemorrhagic stroke.
Trepanation is a surgical intervention in which a hole is drilled or scraped into the human skull to treat health problems related to intracranial diseases or release pressured blood buildup from an injury. It is one of the oldest surgical procedures known to humanity, with evidence of its practice dating back to the Neolithic era. While it is a simple and straightforward procedure, it carries a high risk of infection and complications.

A basic surgery that can be performed by anyone with rudimentary medical knowledge. Yields a low success rate.
LanguageData.RemoveHemorrhagicStroke_Tribal.successfu: {0} has successfully cured {1}'s stroke. The patient is lucky to be alive.

LanguageData.RepairCollapsedLung_Industrial.label: repair collapsed lung: thoracotomy
LanguageData.RepairCollapsedLung_Industrial.descripti:
Perform a thoracotomy to repair a collapsed lung.
Thoracotomy is a surgical procedure that involves making an incision in the chest wall to gain access to the lungs and the surrounding structures. The source of the air leak causing the lung collapse is identified and repaired, and pleural space is drained to allow the lung to re-expand and to relieve the pressure on the heart and other organs. Finally, the chest wall is closed and the incision is sutured.

A complex and invasive surgery that requires a skilled surgeon and yields a moderate success rate.
LanguageData.RepairCollapsedLung_Ultratech.label: repair collapsed lung: video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery
LanguageData.RepairCollapsedLung_Ultratech.descriptio:
Perform a video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery to repair a collapsed lung.
Video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS) is a minimally invasive surgical procedure that involves making small incisions in the chest wall and using a camera and specialized instruments to repair the collapsed lung. Since the surgery is performed through small incisions, it is associated with less pain, shorter recovery time, and reduced risk of complications compared to traditional open surgery.

While VATS is less invasive and offers a higher success rate than thoracotomy, it requires highly specialized equipment, additional training, and takes longer to perform, given the complexity of the procedure.
LanguageData.TreatParalysis.label: Restore mobility: cellular regenerative surgery
LanguageData.TreatParalysis.description: Cellular regenerative neurosurgery (CRNS) is an experimental glitterworld surgery that uses mechanites to repair damaged nerve cells in the spinal cord, restoring mobility to a person with permanent paralysis. The procedure is expensive and not widely available, but has shown promising results in restoring mobility, even in very severe cases.
LanguageData.ExtractWholeBloodBag.label: extract blood bag
LanguageData.ExtractWholeBloodBag.description: Extract blood from a patient to retrieve a blood bag that can be used for blood transfusions. If the patient does not have enough blood for a safe donation, the procedure will be aborted.
LanguageData.TreatBrainDamage.label: Treat brain damage: mechanite therapy
LanguageData.TreatBrainDamage.description: Mechanite therapy is a glitterworld treatment that uses mechanites to slowly repair neurological damage in the brain on a cellular level. The procedure is expensive and may take several days to complete, but has shown promising results in restoring cognitive function and memory in patients with severe brain damage. Due to the experimental nature of this treatment, it is not widely available and may require multiple sessions to achieve the desired results.
LanguageData.TreatBrainDamage.jobString: Injecting mechanites into {0}'s brain to repair damage.
